courses.title: Elementary German I
courses.description: An introduction to the German language and the culture of the German-speaking world. Beginning of a survey of basic German grammar and the grammar and the development of the four language skills of listening, speaking, reading, and writing German. Some aspects of everyday life in the German-speaking world will also be introduced.

courses.title: Elementary German II
courses.description: The second part of an introduction to the German language and the culture of the German-speaking world. Completion of the survey of basic German grammar and further development of the four language skills of listening, speaking, reading, and writing German. Aspects of everyday life in the German-speaking world will also be introduced.

courses.title: Intermediate German I
courses.description: A rapid review of grammar with continued use of listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills in German, all with a cultural emphasis.

courses.title: Intermediate German II
courses.description: This course focuses on listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills in German in an introduction to literature and within a cultural context.

courses.title: Introduction to German Literature
courses.description: Introduction to the periods and genres of German literature from the Middle Ages to modern times. Conducted in German.

courses.title: Germany Today
courses.description: Introduction to current issues in contemporary Germany. Lectures, papers, and class discussions. Conducted in German.

courses.title: Conversation and Composition
courses.description: A combination of conversation, composition, and stylistics, this course is designed to promote listening, speaking, and writing proficiency; expansion of vocabulary; stylistic skills.

courses.title: German Stylistics
courses.description: This course introduces students to stylistic difference and idiomatic usages of German, expands vocabulary, and enlarges upon grammatical and syntactic structures.  Taught in German.  Credit not allowed for both GRMN 3026 and GRMN 3026.

courses.title: Crossing Borders in Literature & Culture
courses.description: The class examines politics of immigration and integration such as national, geographic, ethnic, race, gender, and sexuality boundaries in literature and film.  Taught in German.

courses.title: German Fairy Tales: From the Grimm Brothers to Disney
courses.description: Discussion of socio-historical, cultural, and literary themes in German fairy tales, their place in Western tradition, and their echo in contemporary society. Conducted in German.

courses.title: Introductory Business German I
courses.description: Analysis and discussion of texts and videos pertaining to issues in the current business world. Conducted in German.

courses.title: Television & Electronic Culture
courses.description: This course examines the significance of television, computer games, film and online sites (among other sources) in contemporary German culture.  Taught in German.

courses.title: German Business and Technology: Structure, Communication and Correspondence
courses.description: Overview of Germany's business structure, such as industries, service sector, banking system, relation to the European Union, the United States, and the global economy. Site visits. Admission by application only.

courses.title: German Business and Technology: Current Issues
courses.description: Themes oriented toward business German, with emphasis on historical, social, cultural, and political questions pertaining to the development of modern Germany. Admissions by application only.

courses.title: German Business and Technology: Communication
courses.description: Development of language skills through discussions, compositions, journals, oral reports, and presentations. Individual and group projects use interviews, explore German surroundings, and focus on cross-cultural issues. Admission by application only.

courses.description: Permits a group of students and a professor to pursue areas of the German language not covered in other courses in the department.

courses.title: Perspectives of German Media
courses.description: A comparison of differences in representation between various German media sources applied towards the development of a critical understanding of media language to influence, persuade, inform and entertain.

courses.title: Selected Readings in German Literature
courses.description: Study of selected authors, movements, genres, in German literature. Selection varies. Conducted in German.

courses.title: German Film and Literature
courses.description: A survey of German culture and recent past as presented through films and related literary works illuminating Germany's quest for identity since 1945.

courses.title: German Culture & Film
courses.description: This course offers a survey of German Cinema from the 1930s to the 2000s. These films will be analyzed as reflections of the historical, social, and cultural context in which they originated.

courses.title: German Post-Wall Cinema
courses.description: This course offers a cross-section of the most important German films since 1989. Students will analyze the narratives in the context of contemporary German history, society, and culture.

courses.title: Political Songwriting in Germany, 1945 to Present
courses.description: This class offers an overview of political songwriting in Germany  (GDR and FRG) between 1945 and the present. Taught in German.

courses.title: Americanization and Anti-Americanism in the Federal Republic of Germany
courses.description: This class surveys the reception of U.S. culture in West Germany from the end of WWII to today. Taught in German.

courses.title: Advanced Business German I
courses.description: Advanced principles of German business organization and language. Taught through the use of reading, audio, and video materials. Conducted in German.

courses.title: Advanced Stylistics: Grammar and Discourse
courses.description: This course incorporates study of stylistic difference and idiomatic usages of German, expands vocabulary, and solidifies and enlarges upon grammatical and syntactic structures.  Taught in German.

courses.title: Science and Technology in German History and Culture
courses.description: Course surveys the history of science, technology, and industrialization in German-speaking countries, as well as current STEM research in German. Taught in German.

courses.title: Advanced Intercultural Seminar
courses.description: Integrates cross-cultural research and reflection into discussion of current issues Germany.  Intended for students who have had some study-abroad experience in Germany.  Conducted in German.

courses.title: Berlin: The Capital in the 20th Century
courses.description: By engaging contemporaneous topics in film, literature, photography, etc., students will investigate topics that dominated the different periods of Berlin's turbulent history.  Taught in German.

courses.title: Industrial Transformation and German Society/Economy
courses.description: Examination of technological and societal changes resulting from transformation of an industrial area to one dominated by high tech and media industries.  Taught in German.

courses.title: German Internship
courses.description: Professional experience with a business/organization in which students enhance their language skills and cultural knowledge in German in relation to the practical goals/objectives of the entity.
